Entries.D: Test Entry for proprietary dependencies and nonfree software.
Generates web, streaming, ftp or mail server statistics graphically.
Real time mobile and web analytics, crash reporting and push notifications platform.
Distributed, column-oriented, real-time analytics data store.
Simple & trustworthy website analytics.
Real-time web log analyzer and interactive viewer that runs in a terminal.
Hackable time series pattern recognition tool with UI for Grafana.
Leading open-source analytics platform that gives you more than just powerful analytics, formerly known as Piwik.
Google Analytics and Piwik alternative.
Custom analytics platform that allows you to create your own analytics services. Integrate with any data source (web, mobile, IoT etc.), analyze data with SQL and create dashboards.
Serposcope is a free and open-source rank tracker to monitor websites ranking in Google and improve your SEO performances.
Have every single event, from your websites, mobile apps, desktop applications and server-side systems, stored in your own data warehouse and available to action in real-time.
Detailed analytics and reporting for your Mailgun transactional emails.
Simple Dashboarding and GUI Query tool, Nightly Emails and Slack Integration w/ PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redshift and other DBs.
connect to over 18 types of databases (SQL and "NoSQL"), query your data, visualize it and create dashboards. Everything has a URL that can be shared. Slack and HipChat integration.
Modern, enterprise-ready business intelligence web application.
`⚠` Instagram Analytics and Stats.
Web-based, open source application for standards-based archival description and access in a multilingual, multi-repository environment.
Mature digital preservation system designed to maintain standards-based, long-term access to collections of digital objects.
Archives information management application for managing and providing Web access to archives, manuscripts and digital objects.
Self-hosted "wayback machine" that creates HTML & screenshot archives of sites from your bookmarks, browsing history, RSS feeds, or other sources.
Highly configurable Web-based framework for management, description, and discovery of digital and physical collections supporting a variety of metadata standards, data types, and media formats.
Web interface for [youtube-dl](https://github.com/rg3/youtube-dl), a program to download videos and audio from [more than 100 websites](https://rg3.github.io/youtube-dl/supportedsites.html).
Learn how identifiable you are on the Internet (browser fingerprinting tool).
Flexible event and agent system, which allows you to create your own agents that perform automated tasks triggered by events and filters.
A marketing hub allowing to schedule posts on social media (a la Hootsuite+Buffer) and combine them with newsletter campaigns.
CouchPotato is an automatic Video Library Manager for Movies. Automatic torrent/nzb searching, downloading, and processing at the qualities you want.
Self Hosted TV show Episode tracker and recommender built using django, bootstrap4.
FeedMixer is a WSGI (Python3) micro web service which takes a list of feed URLs and returns a new feed consisting of the most recent n entries from each given feed(Returns Atom, RSS, or JSON).

FHEM is used to automate common tasks in the household like switching lamps and heating. It can also be used to log events like temperature or power consumption. You can control it via web or smartphone frontends, telnet or TCP/IP directly.
Gekko is a Bitcoin TA trading and backtesting bot which support multiple exchanges and cryptocurrencies.
Gladys is an open-source home assistant which runs on your Raspberry Pi.
Automated music downloader for NZB and Torrent, written in Python. It supports SABnzbd, NZBget, Transmission, µTorrent, Deluge and Blackhole.
Django app which listens for pings and sends alerts when pings are late.
Open-source home automation platform.
Web app to convert an export bank file to compatible Homebank csv.
Drag-and-drop file conversion server with session based authentication, automatic temporary file maintenance, and logging capability.
Allows you to build agents that monitor and act on your behalf.
Website screenshots/renderer. It uses the wkhtmltox to render websites with various options.
Lightweight personal web assistant with powerful integrations.

LazyLibrarian is a program to follow authors and grab metadata for all your digital reading needs. It uses a combination of Goodreads Librarything and optionally GoogleBooks as sources for author info and book info.
Lidarr is a music collection manager for Usenet and BitTorrent users.
Automatic Video Library Manager for TV Shows. It watches for new episodes of your favorite shows, and when they are posted it does its magic.
Browser-based flow editor that helps you wiring hardware devices, APIs and online services to create IoT solutions.
Vendor and technology agnostic open source software for home automation.
Online tool for creation of RSS feeds for any web page.
Tool that makes it easier to share the content you like thanks to Pocket+Buffer.
Lightweight, customizable and remotely manageable downloader for 1-click-hosting sites like rapidshare.com or uploaded.to.
Radarr is an independent fork of Sonarr reworked for automatically downloading movies via Usenet and BitTorrent, à la Couchpotato.
rss-bridge is a PHP project capable of generating ATOM feeds for websites which don't have one.
PHP script which will take multiple RSS / Atom feeds as input and merge them into a single RSS feed.
SickRage is an automatic Video Library Manager for TV Shows. Automatic torrent/nzb searching, downloading, and processing at the qualities you want.

Automatic TV Shows downloader and manager for Usenet and BitTorrent. It can grab, sort and rename new episodes and automatically upgrade the quality of files already downloaded when a better quality format becomes available.
Open source clone of IFTTT, a bridge between your internet services.
Interface to interact with the aria2 downloader. Very simple to use, just download and open index.html in any web browser.
Why The Fuck Did You Unfollow Me - Find out who stops following you on Twitter.
Zenbot is a lightweight, extendable, artificially intelligent trading bot for Bitcoin, Ether, Litecoin, and more.
Free, lightweight, faster-than-a-bullet, simple blogging system, made for art–directed posts.
Free, open source project aimed at the development of a high performance, feature rich weblog hosting software.
Free blog-engine written in PHP and using SQLite. This offers you both an unmatched simplicity during installation and great performances.
Simple application to build a site or blog in seconds. Bludit uses flat-files (text files in JSON format) to store posts and pages.
Extra-awesome, extra-lightweight blog engine.
A self hosted Medium platform built with Ruby on Rails.
Take control over your blog.
Powerful, flexible, free and open source PHP/MySQL script to manage your forms and data.
Just a blogging platform.
Fast, simple and powerful blog framework, powered by Node.js.
Freehand CMS which allows to construct websites directly in a web-browser. It uses flat files for storage and provides an intuitive GUI.
Databaseless Blogging Platform (Flat-File Blog).
Single website for all your content.
It's a blog, it's a wiki, it's a fast CMS.
Federated blogging engine, based on ActivityPub.
XML-based blog/CMS platform.
Open source blogging platform with inline editing, handlebar templates, and a beautiful user interface.
Blogging system written in Java, feel free to create your or your team own blog.

Python based delicious.com replacement.

Sync Firefox bookmarks, passwords, history, tabs, preferences.
Personal bookmarking service focused on speed and organization using hierarchical tags.
Web application that allows you to create smart bookmarks, commands and aliases by pointing your web browser's default search engine at a running instance. Similar to bunny1 or yubnub.

Very simple software and service to store bookmarks especially designed for hackers (that don't need fancy interfaces, but nice API).
The tiling image board system for people who want to save, tag, and share images, videos, and webpages.
SemanticScuttle is a social bookmarking tool experimenting with features like structured tags and collaborative tag descriptions.
Personal, minimalist, super-fast, no-database bookmarking and link sharing platform.

Keep your browser's bookmarks synchronized without limiting yourself to one provider.

Server for calendar sharing (CalDAV) that uses a PostgreSQL database as a data store.

HawkPost is a web app that lets you create unique links that you can share with a person that desires to send you important information but doesn't know how to encrypt it. The message is encrypted in their browser and sent to your email address.

Self hosted push notification service built with a simple API making sending notifications easy.

Secured and decentralized communication system. Offers decentralized chat, forums, messaging, file transfer.

Opensource helpdesk and ticketing system based on Drupal 7.
DiamanteDesk is FREE Open Source easy-to-use help-desk solution.
Uncomplicated, web-based bug tracking system.
Open source clone of Help Scout: email-based customer support application, help desk and shared mailbox.
Instant project management for your GitHub issues (Connects directly GitHub API).
Self hosted bug tracker, fits best for software development.
Multi language ticket system with FAQ, role management, metrics and canned response features.
Manage, organize and archive all your support requests and responses in one place.
Trouble ticket system for assigning tickets to incoming queries and tracking further communications.
An enterprise-grade issue tracking system.
A powerful error tracking platform with wide language support and a robust API.
SCM-agnostic, file-based, offline-first, immutable issue tracker.
Ticket system with extensive user rights system.
Easy to use but powerful open-source support and ticketing system.
A modern URL shortener with support for custom domains.
URL shortener using a Telegram Bot.
Beautiful, fast URL shortening.
_Let's SHorten That Url_ - Lightweight URL shortener.
URL shortener and file sharer with a drag-and-drop OS X menu bar client and web interface.
Modern, minimalist, modular, and lightweight URL shortener.
URL shortener service written in Scala, using Akka-Http and Redis.
No login, no javascript, just short links.
Simple URL shortener with very tiny URLs.
SHort URI - Lighweight URL shortener.
Shitty url shortener, emoji and AI powered.
YOURLS is a set of PHP scripts that will allow you to run Your Own URL Shortener. Features include password protection, URL customization, bookmarklets, statistics, API, plugins, jsonp.
BookStack is a simple, self-hosted, easy-to-use platform for organizing and storing information. It allows for documentation to be stored in a book like fashion.
Cowyo is a feature-rich wiki for minimalists.
Wiki system with complex functionality for simple integration and a superb interface. Store your knowledge with style: Use django models.
Modern Docs + Wiki software with built-in workflow, single binary executable, just bring MySQL/Percona.
Easy to use, lightweight, standards-compliant wiki engine with a simple syntax allowing reading the data outside the wiki. All data is stored in plain files, therefore no database is required.
Wiki program that stores pages and uploaded files in a git repository, which can then be modified using the VCS command line tools or the wiki's web interface.
Simple, Git-powered wiki with a sweet API and local frontend.
Git based wiki engine written for node.js, with a decent design, a search capability and a good typography.
MediaWiki is a free and open-source wiki software package written in PHP. It serves as the platform for Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia projects, used by hundreds of millions of people each month.
Advanced, easy to use and extensible WikiEngine with a large community of users.
Olelo is a wiki that stores pages in a Git repository, supports many markup styles and has an extensible, hackable architecture.
An open, extensible, wiki for your team built using React and Node.js.
Complete markdown-powered wiki contained in a single PHP file.
Simple, fast, customizable and lightweight site for browsing files.
Wiki-based system for collaborative creation and maintenance of websites.
Raneto is an open source Knowledgebase platform that uses static Markdown files to power your Knowledgebase.
Git-backed wiki inspired by Gollum.
Reusable non-linear personal web notebook.
Wiki CMS Groupware with the most built-in features.
TWiki is a Perl-based structured wiki application, typically used to run a collaboration platform, knowledge or document management system, a knowledge base, or team portal.
Simple Markdown based wiki engine.
Modern, lightweight and powerful wiki app built on NodeJS, Git and Markdown.
Wiki, simple to use and install.
Second generation wiki that allows the user to extend its functionalities with a powerful extension-based architecture.
Self-host web apps, microservices and lambdas on your server. Advanced features enable service reuse and composition.
Build a full-featured home server with this playbook and an Ubuntu box.
Minimal Debian OS optimized for single-board computers, which allows you to easily install and manage several services for selfhosting at home.
Deploy self-hosted apps easily: simple, bloat-free, independent installation.
Home server configuration based on Debian.
Community project to develop, design and promote personal servers running free software for private, personal, communications.

Network-attached storage (NAS) software based on FreeBSD and the OpenZFS file system. Support for SMB, AFP, NFS, iSCSI, SSH, rsync and FTP/TFTP protocols. Advanced features include full-disk encryption and plug-ins.
Your very own offline-first privacy-centric open-source data-center.

OpenMediaVault is the next generation network attached storage (NAS) solution based on Debian Linux. It contains services like SSH, (S)FTP, SMB/CIFS, DAAP media server, RSync, BitTorrent client and many more.
DIY anonymous offline file-sharing and communications system built with free software and inexpensive off-the-shelf hardware.
Lightweight webapp catalog based on containers, with user interface à la mobile app store.
Personal server for running self-hosted apps easily and securely.
Set of Ansible playbooks to build and maintain your own private cloud: email, calendar, contacts, file sync, IRC bouncer, VPN, and more.
Your own online file storage, social network or email server.

Linux distro that runs on indie boxes (personal servers and IoT devices). Single-command installation and management of apps - Jenkins, Mediawiki, Owncloud, WordPress, etc., and other [features](http://ubos.net/about/).
The most comprehensive and integrated Free / Libre / Open Source software suite ever developed.
Server operating system aiming to make self-hosting accessible to everyone.
